subject: Getting Hectic Here
event:
Things are getting hectic here.  I am doing what I hope is the final round of editing on HIGH STAKES, the new Wild Cards mosaic novel, in hopes of delivering that one to the good folks (and they are) at Tor before I take off for Europe.

On Thursday, we're off to Germany.  I have a big event in Hamburg, and Sibel Kekilli has promised to show me her city... seeing as how I showed her Santa Fe a few months ago, it's only fair.  From there I'll be flying to Sweden for a few days in Stockholm, then taking a ferry to the Aland Islands for my long-planned appearance as GOG at Archipelacon. 

I will try to post a few more details about the trip before we fly off. 

(Meanwhile, of course, I still have Puppies nipping at my ankles.  Even the sad ones seem to have gone rabid of late.  tsk)

props.taglist: wild cards, travels, everyday life, conventions

comments.article: Love the series.  I've been reading it since 1988 when I was 18.  Even played Superworld back in the day.  I'm looking forward to seeing the next one.
comments.subject: Wild Cards

comments.article: When you come to Brazil? Its a beautiful place to know.
comments.subject: Come to Brazil, Martin :-)

comments.article: Brazil is on my schedule for 2017, I believe.
comments.subject: Re: Come to Brazil, Martin :-)

comments.article: Hey don't forget about the Son of Kong while you're at it! Also any thoughts about the finale?
comments.subject: Son of Kong?

comments.article:
Again and again and again people like you come on here to remind George to keep on writing Winds. If it gets boring for me when I see these comments on his journal posts then George must be ripping his hair out every time he sees one of these mindless drone-like comments.

And he has repeatedly (even recently) said that he will not comment on the show so go off somewhere else if you don't want to know what else George is working on and doing.
comments.subject: Re: Son of Kong?

comments.article:
Enjoy your trip George, as well as any German beers you happen upon. I'm sure you have aspecific agenda while there, but here's hoping you can enjoy travelling and re-charge your batteries before the next wrestling match against the Song of Kong.

An album I recommend, if you lsiten to music while travelling - "The Promise" by Bruce Springsteen; in the unlikely event you haven't had that one a go yet.

Looking forward to future updates.
Because everyone is so eager for High Stakes for reasons I have yet to figure out.
comments.subject: Oh Goodie!

comments.article: You have many fans in Romania, any visits planned yet?
comments.subject: How about Romania?

comments.article: When are you coming back to Belfast? We like you here :p
comments.subject: Northern Ireland

comments.article: I really enjoyed the INTO THE NIGHT episode where you and Sibel explore Sante Fe. Would be awesome if you filmed your adventures in Hamburg, too. :)
comments.subject: Have fun George!

comments.article: Enjoy your trip to Germany, Stockholm, and Åland Islands. I'm sure it will be great. It must be an exciting if hectic phase of birthing a book to be on the final edit. I can hardly wait for it. Take care.
comments.subject: Germany/Wild Cards

comments.article: Hello! A curious and eager fan wonders if Colorado is on your list of stops in the near future. Meanwhile, enjoy the trip!
comments.subject: Colorful Colorado!

comments.article:
Enjoy Hamburg and Stockholm. I've been born in Hamburg and spent two years in Stockholm as student. Love both places.

If you have time, visit the Vasa museum in Stockholm - that ship will make the Ironborn jealous *grin*. And gamla stan, of course.

forgive me, I'm new here... puppies?


safe travels, Sir. enjoy your adventures

>>forgive me, I'm new here... puppies? <<

Don't ask.
Enjoy the trip George Europe is a great place to visit
comments.subject: Have a fun trip

comments.article: Any plans on visiting Romania soon? Cheers from there!
comments.subject: Wild Cards

comments.article: Afraid not.
comments.subject: Re: Wild Cards

comments.upictitle: the shining bacon of democracy: peacock snake eyes
comments.article: I'm looking forward to your event on Sunday! Welcome to Hamburg!

george veniras I would love to Colombia, and please white puppy renasca of Ice and Fire: 3

if you come to Colombia I would ensure me a good aguardientes ajajaj
comments.subject: colombia ;)

comments.article:
Hello! Your entry got to top-25 of the most popular entries in LiveJournal!
Learn more about LiveJournal Ratings in FAQ.

Hey George, I hope you enjoy your trip.

I have a question that is related to ASOIAF mythology.

I was wondering if Rhae or Daella Targaryen (Egg's and Maester Aemon's sisters) had any children. I am trying to figure out the line of succession, and I get stuck here because there's absolutely no information about them available.

Thanks in advance for your response :)
You are one busy man! I love how you fit it all in and make it work. You make it look easy, sir! I hope you have a safe and fun trip! Love the blog!
comments.subject: Can't Even Imagine

comments.article:
I make it look easy? Really?

I thought I was making it look very hard.

It IS very hard.
comments.subject: Re: Can't Even Imagine

comments.article: Good to see you're finishing up one of your many projects. Enjoy your well-earned break, George.

Not really a break. There's a lot of business mixed in with the pleasure. Press, signings, speeches, panels, interviews... and the travel itself is grueling.

But what the hell. I knew the job was dangerous when I took it.

Don't want to get into a war with puppies or anything, but this era of instant gratification has also become an age of extremism as well.  People refuse to find a middle ground.  The "I'm right, you're wrong and because you don't agree with me I'm not going to listen to you" mentality is doing this world such a disservice.  I mention the instant gratification because of our current society here in America is one that like to avoid telling people they're wrong, while at the same time we keep score of our victories.  This process doesn't work in the real world.
comments.subject: Age of Extremism

comments.article: Have a good one :)
Do enjoy your trip to Europe, good ser! So glad to hear you'll get to meet up with the lovely lady Sibel again. Have fun! Love from Poland.
comments.subject: Europe ahoy

comments.article: Since everyone else is onto you about, when, when, when... thought I'd add my 2 cents. After all, if you can go to Finland (Áland is part of Finland) we're just down the pond from there. We don't allow no rabid puppies here. Do have wolves and wild boar, though.
comments.subject: When are you coming to Estonia?

comments.article: When are you coming to Turkey? Sibel and you should come to İstanbul together, there is a huge group of fans waiting for you!

Enjoy life in all of its beauty. The traveling, the appreciation we have for your work the world over and the hectic monsterous schedule. You are an inspiration to alot of people and we thank you. Take YOUR time and ENJOY.
